sentences: Miehet ovat usein pidempiä kuin naiset.
Nämä miehet tulivat viime yönä kotiin.
context: "Miehet" is the plural form of the Finnish word "mies", which means "man" or "male". It refers to multiple men or males in general. The word follows Finnish grammar rules for pluralization, where the ending changes from singular to indicate more than one person.
